And yet, over 80% of the worlds oceans remain unmapped, making it difficult for scientists to understand the full picture of ocean sustaina… [+1977 chars]

articles.author: Ben Turner
articles.title: Cosmic-ray 'GPS' system that tracks underground movement could change the way we respond to disasters - Space.com
articles.description: A new system that uses subatomic particles produced high in Earth's atmosphere could provide a view inside volcanoes and help locate people trapped beneath rubble.
articles.content: Scientists have harnessed the byproducts of cosmic rays to create the world's first "GPS" system that works underground — and it could be used to monitor volcanoes and aid in future search-and-rescue… [+3945 chars]

articles.author: Ethan Siegel
articles.title: Did physicists get the idea of "fundamental" wrong? - Big Think
articles.description: In physics, we reduce things to their elementary, fundamental components, and build emergent things out of them. That's not the full story.
